line_1: Heighday! what's here? without a beard!
line_2: The shaggy people grinn'd and star'd.

line_1: The Cause, why Woman has no Beard;
line_2: What System, Dick, has right averr'd

line_1: The fair round face, the snowy beard,
line_2: Her conscious tail her joy declared;

line_1: And Bishops pull the Fathers by the beard.
line_2: The servants of the Devil are rever'd,

line_1: At which he shook his grisly Beard,
line_2: But in the Air a Sound he heard,

line_1: At which he shook his grisly Beard,
line_2: Enough to make the Woods affeard,

line_1: The Tears run down his Cheeks and Snowy Beard.
line_2: When that Reproach, poor suffering Angiers heard,

line_1: And list'ning smil'd, and stroak'd his hoary Beard.
line_2: Nereus himself above the Waves appear'd,

line_1: And list'ning smil'd, and stroak'd his hoary Beard.
line_2: She sung — and he with secret Pleasure heard,

line_1: And now in act to speak, he strok'd his beard,
line_2: The first faint dawnings of a smile appear'd,

line_1: At end of it howe'er, unbless'd with beard,
line_2: Some twenty fathom length of chin appear'd;

line_1: For ever hung on drizzly Auster's Beard;
line_2: The sadden'd Country a grey Waste appear'd;

line_1: For ever hung on drizzly Auster's Beard;
line_2: Or else the Ground by piercing Caurus sear'd,

line_1: For ever hung on drizzly Auster's Beard;
line_2: Through these Extremes a ceaseless Round they steer'd,

line_1: No Comet with a Flaming Beard!
With hoary Whiskers and a forky Beard;
line_2: Behold, four Kings in Majesty rever'd,

line_1: Your wisdom gravely measur'd by your beard.
line_2: So you may live, approv'd, perhaps preferr'd,
